title: Smoked Trout and Veggie Salad
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Smoked Trout and Veggie Salad a try. One serving contains 374 calories, 15g of protein, and 27g of fat. This recipe serves 4 and costs $3.78 per serving. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, dairy free, fodmap friendly, and whole 30 diet. 1 person found this recipe to be yummy and satisfying. Head to the store and pick up pepper, crookneck squash, tomatoes, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the lemon juice you could follow this main course with the Lemon Shortbread Cookies with Lemon Icing {A Tribute to Aunt Roxanne} as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 85%. This score is outstanding. Similar recipes include Smoked Trout Salad, Smoked Trout Salad, and Smoked Trout orange Salad.
instructions: In a blender, whirl parsley, olive oil, 2 tbsp. lemon juice, zest, and 1/4 tsp. salt.                                                                                                 In separate bowls, gently toss potatoes and squash with some dressing, and tomato wedges with 1 tsp. lemon juice, adding salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.                                                                                                 On 4 plates, evenly divide veggies and trout. Add more dressing to taste.

steps.step: In a blender, whirl parsley, olive oil, 2 tbsp. lemon juice, zest, and 1/4 tsp. salt.
In separate bowls, gently toss potatoes and squash with some dressing, and tomato wedges with 1 tsp. lemon juice, adding salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
On 4 plates, evenly divide veggies and trout.
